trends: There have been 8 other sightings in Orange Park
There were no other sightings in Orange Park on or around June 13th 2008
Summary: Bright star-like light in NW sky stationary and then sparkled and faded out.
divs: Sighting DetailsI came outside to talk to my husband who was working in the yard and looked up in the sky as I always do. I noticed only one bright 'star' in the NW sky. The sun had already set but the sky was still light so no other stars were visible...only the moon. I got my Orion binoculars and looked at the 'star' and noticed that it was an oval bright white with light greenish and pinkish colors. The oval was in a vertical position. My husband and I looked at it for about 10 minutes and decided it must be a planet. I was going to go inside and look on the internet to see if I could find out what it was. Then my husband and I noticed, (with our naked eyes), that it started fading. I looked through the binoculars again and could see that it was sparking or sparkling like fireworks do when they are falling. It seemed to drop slightly and then slowly faded out. There was no sound and not a cloud in the sky.
